subject: Economics
title: Tech Taxation: The Impossible Challenge
description: Learn Tech Taxation: The Impossible Challenge in one minute.

hook.text: Amazon earned $35 billion in profit in 2023 and paid an effective tax rate of 11%.

buildup.text: Tech companies exploit international tax rules: book profits in low-tax Ireland, costs in high-tax countries.

discovery.text: The 'Double Irish Dutch Sandwich' allowed Google to route profits through Ireland, Netherlands, and Bermuda ‚Äî paying 2.

twist.text: In 2021, 136 countries agreed to a 15% minimum corporate tax.

climax.text: Taxing digital companies challenges the fundamental assumption of tax law: that companies exist in a physical place.

punchline.text: You can't tax what you can't locate. Digital companies live in the cloud.

quiz.question: Why are tech companies particularly difficult to tax?
options: Digital companies can book profits in any jurisdiction since they have no fixed physical presence, exploiting gaps in international tax law
